inn1.comm: back of a length, angling in to the left-hander, and a bit of bounce too. Tharanga blocks it on the jump, getting on top of the bounce, taking his bottom hand off to play it into the on side

goes for the pull straight away, and he gets a big slice of luck. Was too early into the shot, and he got a thick inside-edge that narrowly missed the top of leg stump and ran away to the boundary behind the keeper
lovely line. Again some bounce from back of a length, angling away from Dilshan, and he's opened up and beaten as he tried to defend it. Bit of movement away off the seam too
full now, almost in the blockhole on off stump, and he defends towards mid-off
back of a length again, outside off, and he pushes at it with his hands and steers it away to third man
once again tests Tharanga with some bounce, and he's off his feet and fends it down safely towards short fine leg
bit of swing away from Dilshan, wide outside off, and he lets it go through to the keeper
poor line now, and he flicks it off his pads to the left of deep backward square leg. Lovely flourish, and the back leg goes up as well
length ball on middle stump this time, and he tucks it away towards midwicket
super delivery, and Dilshan pokes away at it as it leaves him and is beaten. Swung away in the air and lifted from a good length
a bit of away movement again, but the length is just short enough for Dilshan to pull that away powerfully through midwicket. He was in position so quickly for that

goes after this one angling away from him outside off and it looks like he's beaten. Threw his bat at that without moving his feet. Umar Akmal was appealing very excitedly, and it wasn't given. Pakistan have gone for a review... It looks like it's just gone under his bat. Was there some inside edge on it? Doesn't quite seem like it, even if there's a slight noise... and the third umpire's given that out!
back of a length, and bounce again for Irfan. Tharanga looks for a run after tucking it away into the leg side, and Sangakkara sends him back
short ball now, angling well down the leg side, and Tharanga ducks under it
wafts at this short ball outside off, and is beaten by extra bounce
this one's a little closer to him, and he jumps to get on top of the bounce and slashes it down to third man
length ball in the corridor, and Sanga shuffles across to defend back to the bowler
short again, and Sangakkara ducks safely underneath

length ball, angling towards middle and off. Sanga shapes to close his bat face and work it through midwicket, but maybe he saw it straighten late, and changed his mind and defended back to the bowler, showing the full face

moves in off the pitch, and Sangakkara is hit on the front pad, on the shuffle, as he falls over and tries to work that leg side. Was going well down the leg side, and Pakistan choose not to review this
comes in again, and he tucks it away with the angle past the square leg umpire
comes halfway forward this time to this fifth-stump ball and drives on the up, a touch away from his body but safely enough, middling it to the cover fielder
that's wide outside off, and it moves away a touch and just about breaches the tram-line. Sanga has to let that go
this is closer to off stump, and a touch shorter. Sangakkara lets it go
fuller now, outside off, and he comes forward and plays a checked drive to the right of cover
back of a length now, angling towards off, and Tharanga defends off the back foot into the covers
back of a length ball, wide outside off, leaving the left-hander. Sanga lets it go
that's fuller, and he gets a nice stride in and drives with that trademark flourish to mid-off
back of a length now, a little closer to off stump, and he goes back and across to defend back to the bowler
back of a length again, and this is angling towards middle stump. Sangakkara shuffles across and tucks it away off his hips to deep backward square leg
short, and he's onto it in a flash to pull it away from just outside off between mid-on and short midwicket
short again, tucking up the left-hander for room, and he rides the bounce and deflects it down to fine leg
and the new bat makes a crisp sound as Junaid overpitches this wide outside off, and he drives with an open face past backward point
short now, not too much width, but he slaps down on it with a lot of bottom-hand and backward point makes a super stop diving to his left

That looked like it went off his toe! That was a length ball outside off, and he comes forward to drive through the off side. He's a little early on his shot, and it went down off the inside half of his bat, into his boot or the ground just by the side of his boot, and pops up to Junaid, who catches casually with his right hand and turns around in appeal. The umpire's gone upstairs, and yup, it's bounced just next to his foot

and now Tharanga reviews! This was short and wide, and he slashed hard at it and it went through to the keeper, who appealed loudly once again. Steve Davis gave it out, and Tharanga reviewed immediately. What will S Ravi make of this? No noise this time as it passed his outside edge, no obvious deflection... and Davis overturns his decision. Not out!
length ball outside off, and he comes forward and drives to cover
length ball again, and that bat makes a lovely sound again as he comes forward and punches on the up into the covers
slants this down the leg side, and the batsman can't get any bat on it as he tries to tickle it fine
back of a length, a bit of width, and he chops it hard towards point
fuller now and straighter, angling towards off stump, and he brings his bat down quickly to defend back to the bowler
short and wide, and he slashes it wide of backward point with a full, flailing follow-through
back of a length, angling in and rising towards the rib-cage. He shuffles across and knocks it smartly down towards deep backward square leg
short and wide again, and Sanga slices under the ball and lifts it high over backward point and well wide of third man
slower ball on a very full length, on off stump, and he blocks it carefully towards mid-on
now Junaid bowls short and wide, and he punches this with a slightly open face, to the left of the backward point fielder

width again, not that short this time, and he's beaten as he looks to slash it through that point region again. Akmal drops it behind the stumps, it went straight into his gloves and out, and, oooh, the slo-mo suggests there was a little top-edge on it
straighter now, back of a length, angling in towards off and middle, and he defends it into the off side
short and wide once again, extremely wide, in fact, just outside the tramline as Tharanga lets it go
width once again, and he punches this off the back foot down to deep point
is it a plan to bowl short and wide? They have protection now, two men on that boundary, and Sanga steers it down to third man
back of a length, angling towards off, and he punches it down the ground to the right of mid-on, who has to break into a sprint to stop that
back of a length, just outside off, and he punches this into the covers

yet again, Sangakkara is out to a long-hop! This time, it was there for the pull, and he middled it, but he also picked out the midwicket fielder, who didn't have to move at all to catch that at chest height
nice delivery to greet Mahela, length ball on a fourth-stump line, angling across, and the batsman lets it go
back of a length now, a little closer to off, and he defends off the back foot towards cover point
back of a length again, a touch wider now, not much bounce, and he punches it towards extra cover
a touch shorter now, and that allows Mahela to ride the bounce, open his bat face, and steer it down to third man
length ball, angling across in the corridor, and Mahela lets it go
full now, wide outside off, inviting the cover drive, and he plays the shot. Afridi misfields at short cover, and they sneak a single
length ball now, outside off, and Tharanga comes forward and pushes it to mid-off

that was there for the flick, on the pads, and he gets a four for it but not how he would have wanted to. It went very uppishly, between the square leg umpire and the midwicket fielder, and bounced away to the boundary. It may have stopped on the pitch, and bounced a little extra
back of a length now, on off stump, and he opens up a touch as he defends back to the bowler
a touch too straight now, and he tucks it away towards midwicket off his pads
angles this down the leg side now, and he gets a bit of pad on it as he looks to work that away towards fine leg. Akmal dives across to his right but can't stop the ball running away to the boundary

lovely delivery, and once again Wahab gets Tharanga to poke at it outside off, no footwork. It shaped away, and he's stuck in his crease, moving neither forward, back, nor across, and gets an outside edge through to the keeper

there's that big shuffle across the stumps, and Wahab may have been looking to target that early on and bowl him around his legs maybe... it bounced extra and went off his thigh pad, and once again it's four leg byes as Akmal dives despairingly across
that's a fairly full length outside off, but Mathews is on the back foot as he lets it go
back of a length now, and he shuffles across and works this from off stump towards midwicket
back of a length again, and Mahela is on the hop as he tucks it away towards the leg side, dropping his bottom hand as he does so
that's wide outside off, slanting away from Mahela, and Irfan is lucky the umpire didn't call that wide
very full now, looking for the yorker, and it goes down the leg side as Mahela shuffles across to try and flick. Once again, a touch fortunate that wasn't called wide
length ball now, on off stump, and he comes forward and drives to mid-off
back of a length now, angling away on a fifth-stump line, and he gets both feet off the ground to steer that towards backward point
full, on the pads, and it's flicked uppishly but bounces down well short of the deep midwicket fielder
back of a length now, a touch too straight, and it's worked off the hips to deep midwicket.
back of a length outside off. Doesn't really come on as he looks to punch through the off side, and he hits it back towards the bowler in the end
short, down the leg side, and Wahab was lucky Mathews didn't get any bat on that as he shuffled across and looked to help it away
fuller now, outside off, and he's shuffled so far across he can defend to short midwicket with a straight bat
full ball outside off, and he takes a huge step back and across and a short step forward to defend back to the bowler
onto the pads, and it's tucked away to deep backward square leg
length ball, a bit of width outside off, but Pakistan have a deep cover to cut off that drive from Mahela
back of a length outside off, and Mathews chooses to leave this one
back of a length, angling in from outside off, and he opens his bat face to steer it down to deep point
length ball on a sixth-stump line, and Mathews lets it go
shortish outside off, leaves him a touch, and he doesn't quite middle it as he dabs it away towards point
angling in, fairly full, and he shuffles across and works that with the angle, from just outside off to the deep backward square leg fielder
that's full and wide, and he drives to the left of a diving short cover
that's a touch too full, and he whips it from outside off stump, wide of mid-on, a la VVS Laxman
back of a length, and he punches it away into the covers
that isn't too short, and that doesn't get up too much, and he swivels to pull it from thigh-height, and it goes between Irfan's legs on the deep backward square leg boundary
length ball on the stumps, and he blocks it back to the bowler
that's full, gives him a bit of width, and short cover reacts quickly to move to his right and cut off that drive
a touch short, a bit of width, and he slaps this hard to point
length ball, angling towards the top of off stump, and he plays late to defend towards square cover
pitched up and that is driven back towards the bowler
gets well forward and blocks this one
pitched up and a hint of spin away, more forward defense
gets back in the crease and blocks towards the off side
worked towards deep square leg for a single

leading edge as the ball spins across the batsman after pitching outside leg, bit of confusion between the batsmen, but they decide to go for the single, might have been tight but the fielder doesn't pick it up cleanly
short of length and angling across, guided down towards third man for a single
short of a length ball just outside off, 138kph, defended back towards the bowler
thick inside edge onto the pads as Mathews looks to defend to the leg side off the back foot, Wahab has his hands on his head
on the pads and this tucked towards deep midwicket for two
stands tall as he blocks this back of length ball towards the bowler
overpitched, Mathews stretches forward to reach the ball, eases it past the bowler for a boundary to end the over
spinning away after pitching well outside off, driven towards sweeper cover
goes deep in the crease as he punches the ball back at the bowler, Afridi stretches out his left hand to stop that
steers this one towards point
fuller and pitching around off stump, blocked back towards the bowler
Afridi had dives to his left to stop one earlier this over, this time he had to move to his right to stop a push
punches it towards long-off for a single
spinning in towards off stump, defended to the leg side
skips down the track and eases the ball towards wide long-on
length ball turning in towards the off stump, defended off the front foot
length ball, bottom hand comes off the handle as Mathews drives it towards long-on
length ball is tucked towards square leg
length ball is pushed towards long-on for one more
flights this one, defended towards midwicket by Jayawardene
slightly overpitched, Mahela capitalises, he lifts this inside-out over extra cover for four, no attempt to hammer it
blocked towards the leg side this time
dabs this one towards third man
launches it towards long-off, Junaid Khan misfields there to give away an extra run
defends this one off the front foot
spinning in towards the pads, worked towards midwicket
scoops this one towards fine leg, played very fine by Jayawardene, getting down on his knee and helps it down for four
spinning in towards off stump, clipped towards midwicket
skips down the track and nudges the ball towards deep square leg for one
turning towards middle, pushed from the crease towards long-on

overpitched and just outside off, Jayawardene picks that up and launches it towards deep midwicket, again no attempt to power the ball, just wanted to find the gap, he does, Jayawardene looking to get a move on now
drops it short, slapped back towards the bowler
tucked towards square leg for a single
sprays that way down the leg side, would have been a wide, but Jayawardene seems to have got a bit of bat on it as he sweeps, four more
flighted and full, on the pads, helped towards deep backward square leg
length ball sliding towards leg, worked to the leg side for a single

superbly done by Jayawardene, waits for the ball to arrive and then chops it with the turn, past backward point for four, once again MJ showing power is not essential for quick runs, he has moved to 40 off 40, he was helped here by a shoddy bit of fielding in the ring

Shahzad starts with a ripper, a flighted delivery, pitching on a length and drawing Mathews forward, the ball spins past the outside edge, keeper collects and takes off the bails, Mathews' backfoot is in the crease though
whipped to long-on for a single
full toss way outside off, that is the danger with a part-time legspinner, this is put away behind point for four
loopy delivery, length ball is driven towards sweeper cover
another full toss, pushed towards long-off for a single
length ball is driven towards cover off the front foot
length ball is driven towards long-on
solid forward defensive to a length ball just outside off
clipped towards midwicket this time
a touch short and well outside off, Jayawardene dabs it towards third man for a single
spinning in towards the pads, tucked behind square leg
spinning down the leg side, helped along towards fine leg
full ball outside off, driven towards long-off for a single
full toss well outside off, driven towards sweeper cover
another hit-me full toss, slammed towards long-off for a single
gets forward and defends towards cover, sets off for a quick single that brings up a wonderful half-century
another full toss, bottom hand comes into play as he swipes that to the wide long-on boundary for four
short of length and outside off, defended off the front foot
fired in full and straight, and he clips it down to deep midwicket
full on off stump, pushed back to the bowler
fired in flat on off stump, and he has no option but to push this back to Hafeez
a touch shorter now, and he goes back and tucks this away to deep backward square leg
length ball outside off, no turn,and he pushes it back to the bowler
once again, length ball outside off, and Mahela plays it defensively, wristily, back to Hafeez
full, angling in towards off, and he dives left to stop that defensive push from Mathews
full ball outside off, and he comes forward to drive to long-off
length ball outside off, and he defends with soft hands to the left of cover
a little bit of air this time, and it gives Mahela enough time to sink to his knees and slog-sweep that from outside off, one bounce over the midwicket boundary
angled in towards off stump, full, and he works it with the angle backward of square
full on off stump, and he works this with the spin to midwicket
full outside off, driven down wristily to long-on
length ball outside off, nurdled behind square with the turn
goes on the back foot to this as it turns sharply from off stump, and it beats him for pace and hits him high on the pad
full and straight, pushed to midwicket
length ball on off, defended into the on side
a touch short, and Mahela snatches a little too eagerly at this attempted pull. Is beaten as he's too quickly into the shot, and a bit of turn away as well
full on off stump, driven down to long-off
back of a length, goes with the angle towards off, and Mathews chops it back to the bowler, after looking for the cut initially
onto the pads now, and he works this away to the right of midwicket to bring up the century stand
full, tossed up wide outside off, and he's driven it to deep cover
length ball outside off, defended to short cover

that's a poor shot from Mahela, looks to sweep this length ball from the stumps. Is hit on the front pad, but is it angling down the leg side? The umpire thinks so, and Misbah decides not to review. That looked very close... hit him in front of middle stump
length ball outside off, pushed back to the bowler
flat length ball outside off, and he comes forward and works it wide of mid-on
full outside off, and he drives to mid-off
goes back this time and works this from off stump towards square leg
full on off stump, and he clips it away towards midwicket
length ball, turning from middle to off, defended carefully down the ground
a touch shorter now, and he goes back and tucks this away towards midwicket. Wanted the single, sent back
tossed up a little, driven back to the bowler
length ball, angling in towards off stump, defended into the leg side
that's down the leg side, and he misses the ball as he looks to sweep this fine. The ball bounces off Akmal's pads and runs down to the boundary
that's slogged from outside off, and it bounces down to the deep midwicket fielder
short, a bit of width, and he steers this down to backward point
down the leg side now, and he works this away, with the turn, backward of square
tossed up on off stump, and he comes forward and plays with the turn to midwicket
looked to open his face and steer that past point from outside off, and it turned in and took his inside edge, ran down past the stumps towards fine leg
angles this towards leg stump, and they run a quick one as Fawad sprints to his left from square leg and dives to stop the ball
length ball on the pads, flicked to deep midwicket
down the pitch now, and he works it with the turn to long-on
length ball, defended into the off side
full, on the stumps, whipped wristily to midwicket
back of a length now, and he waits on it and dabs it down towards backward point
flat, and a touch short, and he lap-pulls with low hands to deep backward square
on the pads now, and it's tucked away to the left of deep backward square leg
length ball outside off, and he looks to dab it towards cover and run a single, but is sent back by Mahela
length ball on middle stump, and he tucks it away backward of square
full on off stump, clipped to midwicket
flat, slightly back of a length, and he goes on the back foot and punches it down to long-on
that was angled in towards off, and he initially shaped to play into the on side, but it went with the angle and he defended carefully into the off side

what was he thinking there? That was quick and flat, and he looked to give himself room and cut. It went straight on as he exposed all his stumps, and crashed into off stump as he reached out and missed the ball
length ball on off, and he defends towards cover
length ball on off, and he defends off the front foot
length ball again, outside off this time, and he dabs it towards point
fuller now, just outside off, and he pushes it back to the bowler
length ball outside off, goes straight on, and Mathews reads it and defends into the on side
short, a bit of width, goes with the arm, and he mistimes this chop towards point. Fawad runs in quickly and lets go of the throw, but misses the stumps. Prasanna was just in, I think
full, angling in towards off stump, and he defends back to the bowler
back of a length on off stump, and he nurdles it behind square leg off the back foot
slants this down the leg side, and short fine leg has to be alert to stop this powerful sweep
goes with the arm towards off stump, and he gets a leading edge towards cover as he closes his bat face too early
back of a length on the pads, and it's tucked away to the left of the backward square fielder to bring up another half-century. Can he finally convert this one?
that's flat and fast, on middle stump, and it's swept to that short fine leg fielder again

goes for that sweep again, and misses. He's hit on the front pad and the umpire has no hesitation. That turned in from outside off, and did that strike him in line? They haven't reviewed, but that seemed to strike his knee-roll just on the line of off stump or slightly outside. Sri Lanka don't take the review. Just as well. Hawkeye says umpire's call.
short and wide, and Shehzad dives to his right from backward point to stop that well-struck square cut
short and wide again, and it's cut down to deep cover point
length ball on off stump, and he defends from the crease towards cover
full and wide, and he gets a thick outside edge down to third man as he looks to come forward and slap that through square cover
back of a length, angling away outside off, and he dabs it between point and cover off the back foot

shortish ball, and he gets it to lift as well, but he's nicely behind it and on top of the bounce to drop it down with soft hands, leg side of the pitch, and run a quick single as Irfan chases it in his follow-through
length ball, angling in towards off stump, and he defends into the covers
back of a length, follows the batsman as he looks to make room, and forces him to tuck it away off his hips towards backward square leg
that's full and flat on off stump, and he drives it down to long-on
that's full on off stump, and he was looking to make room to maybe hit over cover, but it was too quick for that and he blocks it into the covers

and Hafeez has struck again! Priyanjan reviews after he's given lbw, struck on the front pad as he thrust it across the crease trying to work it from off stump into the leg side. The ball struck him in line with off stump, Hawkeye says, and the umpire's decision stands.
flat, length ball, angling towards off, and Thisara, like left-handers are advised to do against this bloke, defends carefully back to Hafeez
length ball, angling away from off stump, and he blocks this towards cover
short now, and the angle provides him a lot of widtth, but once again Shehzad dives to his right to stop that well-timed cut
back of a length on off, and he uses his wrists to work this to the right of short midwicket
back of a length, just outside off, and he opens his bat face and dabs it down to third man
drifts onto the pads now, and that's a freebie for Mathews, who tucks it away to the left of short fine leg to pick up an easy boundary
back of a length, angling towards off, and he is back and across to work that towards midwicket
that's short, down the leg side, and he helps it away to the fine leg boundary. Terrible start to the spell for Wahab
walks across this stumps and works this back of a length ball from outside off towards midwicket

down the pitch now, and he looks to flat-bat it down the ground but Wahab's legs are in the way and it runs away towards long-on. Anwar Ali, the substitute fielder, chases back and makes a good stop just short of the rope
short ball, a bit of width outside off, but he can't connect well enough and chops it down into the ground. Point sprints in and stops the single
back of a length, tucking him up for room, and he defends into the covers
back of a length, and he works this from outside off towards mid-on
onto the pads, and he tucks it away to deep midwicket
full outside off, and he's worked that wristily into the midwicket region
looks to slog-sweep from outside off and misses the line
length ball wide outside off. He looks to chop this behind point and gets an inside edge that runs away towards short fine leg
that's a quick offcutter that turns from outside leg. Pushes it back to the bowler
tossed up outside off, and he works it into that vacant midwicket region again
length ball outside off, and it's driven down to deep cover
length ball on the pads, and he pushes this to midwicket with a straight bat
that's in the blockhole, and it dips in late, and he digs it out towards midwicket
full on off stump, and he drives it down to long-on
length ball outside off, and he didn't get hold of it at all. Looked to slap that through the off side, I think, and ended up hitting it down to long-on
back of a length on off stump, and he pushes it down to long-on
full, on the pads, and it's clipped away to deep midwicket
back of a length, slanting away outside off, and he dabs it away to the right of backward point
fullish, angling towards off stump, and he clears his front leg to make room and drives it to long-on
back of a length, outside off, and he shuffles across and dabs it into the covers. And that's a no-ball as well, since Junaid has kicked away a stump as he approached the crease
full ball on leg stump, and he's hit on the pad as he tries to work it away leg side. Ball rolls away into the off side
back of a length on off stump, and he looks to dab it into the off side and run but it's too close to the bowler
back of a length again, and this time he takes off after pushing it to point. Shehzad, I think, throws at the batsman's end and misses, and they run an overthrow
back of a length, and he works it from outside off to deep backward square leg
sees Mathews stepping out of his crease and giving himself room and bangs it in. It's angling away all the time and he wafts and misses
now he bowls the bouncer, and Mathews misses the pull. Well directed, just over shoulder height
lovely delivery, this. Slower one, and it leaves him from middle stump and beats him as he looks to make room
now he shuffles across and works this shortish ball to the backward square leg fielder
back of a length outside off, and he dabs it away towards cover and sets off for the quick single
that's a low full-toss on the pads, and he clips this with a lot of power to the boundary behind square leg
back of a length, comes in a touch. May have been looking to push this to cover, and ends up inside-edging towards deep square leg
comes down the track, and Junaid senses his intentions, possibly, and bowls a little shorter, a little wider outside off, and Mathews is beaten trying to slap that through the off side
back of a length ball, and it sits up as he clears his front leg and pulls powerfully to the deep midwicket boundary
sees him coming down the track and bowls it wide of off, but Mathews was expecting it this time and kept his shape to connect beautifully and slap that over extra cover. Top shot
slower ball, doesn't come out right, and it's a full-toss wide of off stump, but Mathews is unbalanced as he backs away and is beaten trying to carve that through the off side
that's full on off stump, and he hits the ball hard into the pitch as he looks to drive down the ground. The ball bounces over Wahab, who gets a hand to it but can't save the single
full outside off, driven down to long-off
looks for the yorker, and gets his line all wrong, slanting it well down the leg side
that's a length ball outside off, and he clears his front leg and launches that cleanly over long-on
that's a low full-toss on the stumps, and he heaves that down to long-on
gives himself room, and this is a juicy length ball outside off that he drills hard wide of mid-off
slower ball this, and it comes in off the pitch and follows Mathews as he backs away outside leg. Hits his pad and ricochets into the off side
short and wide, and he gets on top of the bounce to cut this hard to the right of backward point. The sweeper runs around to stop this on the boundary
shuffles way outside off stump and works the ball from a sixth-stump line to deep square leg
that's a low full-toss on off stump, and he's given himself room and scooped that just wide of cover, who dives desperately to his left
short outside off, and he backed away, threw his bat at it, and got a thick edge that flew high over the keeper for four
backs away again, and this time it's a full slower ball that he flays away over cover
that's a length ball on middle-and-off, and he clears that front leg and launches it back over the bowler's head
back of a length on the pads, and he clips it away to the left of short fine leg. Lots of bottom-hand to get power on that, because that came in and tucked him up

and he misses out on that century once again! looked to slog that away from outside off, and didn't get hold of it at all, presenting the midwicket fielder a simple catch to his left. Mathews kicks at the turf as he walks away, and throws away one of his gloves as he approaches the boundary rope
back of a length, and he works it off his hips backward of square
waist-high full-toss on the stumps, and he flat-bats it down to long-on
slower ball angling towards off stump, and he tucks this away to the right of midwicket
that's a low full-toss on the pads, and he gets four more with a sweetly timed pick-up shot over wide mid-on
in the blockhole, and he works it into the leg side
looks for the yorker again, and he slips it down the leg side. Akmal dives to his right, gets his gloves to it, but can't hold on
that's full outside off, driven straight to extra cover
full-toss outside off, and he plays a checked drive wide of long-on
low full-toss on leg stump, and he's backed away and somehow got under it to launch that over long-off
slower bouncer now, and Perera can't get any bat on it as he tries to pull
another slower bouncer, outside off, and Perera lets it go, looking to pick up a wide, but that's just inside the tram-line
full ball outside off, and it's driven hard down to long-off
wow! That was short, it followed Perera as he looked to make room, and his bottom hand fell off the handle as he played the pull, but he's still got enough power on it to clear the midwicket boundary
that's full and wide and he drives it to extra cover
that's a full-toss wide outside off, and he steers it down to third man, a touch uppishly

that's another full-toss, at bail-height, and he pulls it away down to deep midwicket. They go for a second, but the throw catches him well short at the keeper's end. Goes to the third umpire but there was really no need for it. Well played, Thisara!
and he sends down the perfect yorker that crashes into the base of off and middle as Malinga backs away, looking to make room

inn2.comm: big inswing from back of a length outside off, and hits him on the pad, but he's shuffled outside the line
back of a length outside off, no swing this time, and he lets it go
bit of swing in again, and he gets behind the line to defend towards mid-off
once again, the same length, the same line outside off, and he shuffles across his crease to defend towards cover
down the pitch now, and there's a lot of inswing from outside off, which forces him to play defensively to mid-off
that's a little fuller than the earlier deliveries, straighter too, and he shuffles across and defends with the swing to mid-on
a bit of width outside off and he slaps that away past point, who got a hand to it on the dive
fuller now, angling in towards off stump, and he gets forward to push it between point and cover
onto the pads, and Seekuge dives full-length at square leg to stop this well-timed clip from Shehzad
short ball now, and he ducks and sways simultaneously to let that pass over his right shoulder
short again, and this time he was ready for it. Pulls it from outside off to the midwicket boundary. Seekuge runs back from square leg and puts in a desperate but futile dive
length ball angling towards off stump, and he shuffles across and defends back to the bowler
full on off stump, angling across, and he plays a checked drive to mid-off
drifts onto leg stump now, and he misses the clip but gets a bit of pad on it down to the fine leg boundary
back of a length, gives Sharjeel a bit of width thanks to the angle, and he plays a backfoot drive to the right of point, with a high front elbow
a bit of width again, and Seekuge has to dive full-length to his right from cover point to stop that well-timed punch
down the leg side again, and Sharjeel misses out, failing to connect with the flick and he's hit on the pad
onto the pads again, and this time he clips it elegantly to the left of short fine leg. Poor over from Kulasekara, after that maiden first up
back of a length, just outside off, and he punches it down to mid-off
down the pitch, gives himself room and looks to thrash this through cover, and gets an inside edge down towards fine leg
fullish, angling in towards middle, defended back to the bowler
angles this in again and he looks to whip him through the leg side, and doesn't connect well at all. Abbreviated follow-through, and the ball pops straight into the hands of mid-on.
short ball, and Hafeez is off and running with a withering pull over the square leg umpire that races away to the boundary

uppish, but it's safe. Looked to flick from off stump, and maybe that stopped on him, and he managed to clear the short midwicket fielder and place it far enough to his left to pick up another boundary
Length ball on off stump, and he's punched that on the up through cover and timed it beautifully. Mid-off chases back but can't cut it off
a touch shorter now, and a bit of inswing too, but he's in a great position to play that punch again, this time to the left of short cover
back of a length, moves in towards off stump, and he defends back to the bowler
inward movement again, and he stays next to the line of the ball and punches it to short cover
back of a length outside off and he jumps back and across and plays this with the swing towards mid-on
inswing again, and that shuffle allows him to flick that away from off and middle, well wide of the short fine leg fielder
down the leg side, and Hafeez can't quite connect with the attempted flick
on the pads again, and he flicks this elegantly through midwicket, leaning over the ball. Mid-on has no chance of stopping that, neither does deep square leg
back of a length now, just outside off, and he punches it to short cover
back of a length again, and just enough width for him to punch that through a narrow gap to the left of the short cover fielder. Superb timing, that
beautiful on-the-up drive, straight to short cover
back of a length now, and they have a deep cover in place to pick up that punch from Hafeez
fuller now, slower ball as well, and he waits on it and defends to short cover
onto the pads, and he tucks it away to deep backward square leg
tossed up, angling in towards off, and he gets a big forward press to defend back to the bowler
down the pitch, and he drives elegantly, against the turn with a lot of wrist, down to long-on
down the pitch again, and this time he gives himself a bit of room and lofts that over mid-off
drifts onto the pads again, and he uses his wrists and manages to place it far enough to the right of a diving short fine leg to get himself another boundary
once again a touch too straight, and he tucks it off his pads towards deep square leg
back of a length, and he shuffles across and works that from off stump down towards deep square leg
back of a length outside off, and he shuffles across and defends to mid-off
fuller now, on the pads, and he clips it to square leg
back of a length outside off, and he looks to defend with soft hands and run a single but it goes too quickly to mid-off for that
onto middle stump now, and he's pushed it just wide of midwicket
short ball outside off and he swats it dismissively wide of mid-on
on the pads, and that's clipped away to deep square leg
back of a length, and he's whipped that wristily from wide outside off stump to mid-on
back of a length, a bit of movement in off the pitch from outside off, but he's nicely behind it to defend
fuller now, and he punches firmly to mid-on. Too firmly for the single that he's initially looking for, and he sends Hafeez back
short again, it sits up, and he picks up another boundary with the pull. Is beautifully set up on a nice stable base, and he lifts that easily over wide mid-on
bit of inswing, but it drifts into the pads, and he plays the pick-up shot to the left of deep backward square leg
length ball outside off, and he comes forward, looks to drive through cover point, maybe, and gets a thick outside edge that runs away to the third man boundary
back of a length now, angling into the stumps, and he goes back and across and defends down the pitch
full-toss on the pads, was looking for the yorker maybe, and he's clipped that away smartly to the right of short fine leg
length ball outside off. It was the slower ball, and he came forward initially, looking for the cover drive, and then adjusted late to open his face and steer it to point
another slower ball, a little shorter than the previous one, and he guides it down to third man
another slower ball outside off, and he comes forward and pushes it into the covers
flighted length ball on off stump, stretches forward and pushes it towards mid-on
pitched up and that is driven to long-on for one more
keeps it on off stump, defended back towards the bowler
nurdled towards square leg for a single
spinning away a touch after pitching just outside off, defended towards point
this ends up as a full toss as the batsman skips down the track, driven to long-on for a single
full ball outside off, driven towards sweeper cover for a single
short of length ball outside off, defended towards cover off the back foot
a touch short from Perera, in the form Hafeez is in, this is much too short, he hoicks it away to the square-leg boundary for four
shot! superb hit to get to his 50, a stylish cover drive off the front foot for four, his team-mates in the dressing room are up on their feet to applaud this blistering innings
short and outside off, slashed behind point for a cracking boundary, Hafeez 54 off 29 now
edges this down towards third man for a single, keeps the strike
defended off the front foot to the right of the bowler
length ball pitching just outside off, turning away a hint, blocked off the front foot
slides on towards middle stump, clipped towards square leg for two, and the Pakistan hundred is up
gets on the back foot and chops this towards backward point
pushed back towards the bowler this time
solid forward defensive to end the over, one which Sri Lanka will be thrilled with after the fireworks over the past hour, just two runs scored
Herath bowls it on a length, heading for the pads, defended to the leg side
a touch short, chopped towards cover
spinning in towards middle, blocked towards the bowler
moves away from the stumps, Shehad looks to thump that through cover, beaten
fifth dot ball in a row, pushed towards extra cover
a maiden over, the second of the innings, bit of confusion in the running as well, Shehzad pushed the ball to the left of the bowler and set off, but a diving stop meant he had to turn back
ten dot balls in a row now, defended off the front foot
make that 11, Hafeez blocks it back towards the bowler
the streak is over, pushed through the covers for a single
drags it short as he sees the batsman charging down, more defence towards the bowler
spinning away after pitching well outside off, carved towards deep point
slides on towards off stump, poked to the off side, Dilshan swoops in, a tight single is taken
takes a couple of paces to get near the pitch of the ball, eases it towards long-off for a single
full ball is driven towards long-off for a single
gets the front leg out of the way as he whips a slightly short ball towards midwicket, can't place it properly though
skips down the pitch and taps the ball towards long-off for one more
gives this one some drift and gets some turn away, surprises Hafeez who is beaten
steers this one towards backward point
down the pitch, met it on the full, whipped it to long-on for a single
pitched up, batsman skips out of the crease once more, patted to long-on for one more
flighted full toss, another single to long-on
slides this one straight, Hafeez is hurried into defending it from deep in the crease
whips this one towards deep square leg for one more
length ball on middle, spinning across, thick inside edge towards backward square leg
gets out of the crease but he can't get a run, blocks this one towards midwicket
short of length and well outside off, cut away by Shehzad, but not past point
drives this to the right of Herath, who needs gets into a tangle with the non-striker as he tries to field the ball
length ball is driven a touch uppishly towards cover, lands short of the fielder
turning in from legstump, Hafeez is pushed back in the crease as he defends
clips this one towards midwicket for a single

got 'im, the breakthrough Sri Lanka were desperate for, Hafeez's superb innings is over, Prasanna's attempted legbreak slides straight on, Hafeez played for the turn, it doesn't, goes past the inside edge and Hafeez is struck low on the pads in front of off, the umpire needed no time at all to raise the finger
length ball spinning away, Umar Akmal gets well forward as he defends

another one this slides on, seemed like Akmal could have been bowled there, but he gets the bat down in time as he chops that of the back foot, a direct hit from Dilshan at the non-striker's end would have got Akmal run out, he had lost his bat as well, the throw is wide though
big turn this time, surprises the batsman, who manages to defend to the off side
careful defence from Shehzad after that previous ripper
defended toward point to end a probing over

he might have missed the direct hit in the last over, but he has his man first ball, flights it, and gets the ball to turn, off the glove, onto the pad, pops up for Sangakkara, Pakistan are three down and in some bother, the pitch is taking turn, the Sri Lankan corwd has found its voice, and this game is changing rapidly
Misbah sweeps it fine down the leg side, Sanga has shuffled to the leg side in anticipation but he can't stop the single
swept firmly towards deep square leg for a single
aiming for the pads, Misbah tucks this towards square leg, Malinga gets across quickly but can't pick it up cleanly
length ball is driven to the right of the bowler
overpitched and that is driven towards long-on for a single to end the over
full-toss again, on leg stump, and Shehzad sweeps powerfully to the square leg boundary
tossed up, drops on a nice length outside off, and he defends into the covers
down the pitch and looks to dab it into the off side for a quick single, sent back, wisely, by Misbah
it was the googly, but it was a long hop outside off, and he gets away as he chops it straight to point
back of a length, hurries on with the angle, and he punches it back to the bowler off the back foot
full on middle and leg, worked straight to midwicket
onto the pads, and he tucks it away to square leg
onto the pads again, and he finds square leg again
now he goes deep in his crease, opens up and looks to punch it to long-on, but short midwicket dives in to prevent the single
comes forward now to work it from outside off, and once again short midwicket puts in the dive
back of  a length now, and he manages to squeeze it down to long-on and get off strike
jumps down the pitch now, and he fires it flat. Pushed back to the bowler, who fires a throw at the stumps as Shehzad hurries back to regain his crease
full, on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
tossed up now, on the stumps, defended back to the bowler
down the pitch now, and he pushes it to short cover
flatter now, angled in towards off and middle, defended off the front foot
full and flat again, pushed back to the bowler
flat and full again, outside off this time, Misbah drives, and short cover dives to his right to save the single and bring up the maiden for Herath
short, and he goes deep in his crease to punch it to deep cover
flat on leg stump, and he laps it down to deep backward square leg
flat and full on off, Shehzad chooses to defend off the back foot
tossed up now, and he comes forward and clips it to the left of short midwicket
down the pitch now and drives down to long-on
back of a length, and he shuffles across and places it to the left of short midwicket to pick up two
full ball, inside-edges this to backward square leg and they run a quick single
down the pitch now, and it's driven down to long-off
full, angling in towards off stump, driven back to the bowler
tossed up outside off, driven to deep cover
goes with the angle, slants down the leg side, and Misbah is hit on the pad as he misses the flick
down the pitch now, and he bowls it a touch flatter, forcing Misbah to defend
shortish ball outside off. Looks to poke it towards third man and is beaten
down the pitch now, and he floats it up outside off, driven down to long-off
down the pitch, and he fires it leg-side. Clipped down to deep backward square leg
short, a bit of width, and he cuts this well wide of deep point, to his left, and picks up two runs to reach his fifty
down the pitch, and he drives this flat, leg-stump ball down to long-on
tossed up outside off, and he whips it to long-on
nicely tossed up on off stump, and he presses forward to defend
down the pitch and he spots that and fires it leg side. Sticks out a pad to kick it away into the off side
back of a length, and he goes deep in his crease to push that down to long-on
tossed up wide outside off, and he drives this to point. Didn't quite reach the pitch of the ball
full on leg stump, and he drives inside-out through cover without quite timing it
back of a length, slides on towards off stump, and he pushes it off the back foot to wide long-on
short and wide, and he slaps that hard to the right of deep cover
sweeps this from outside off, straight to square leg
quickish length ball on off, and it goes with the angle, and he plays that to midwicket with lots of bottom-hand
down the pitch now, and whips it to long-on
down the pitch, and it's a high full-toss that he slices to deep cover. Didn't quite get hold of it
gives himself room, Priyanjan sees that and fires it full on middle and leg, and he works it towards midwicket, where an alert Dilshan moves quickly to save the single
goes for the slog-sweep from outside off. Doesn't turn, beats the inside edge, and misses off stump
down the pitch, and whips it over wide mid-on, long on runs to his right to cut off the boundary

what a catch that is! Sanga has been alert to the miscued sweep all along, and he moved to the leg side in a flash as soon as Shehzad shaped for the lap sweep from outside off. It went off the face of his bat but he was already on the move, and stretching to his left to intercept that with his gloves. Spectacular bit of awareness, that!
length ball, angled across the left-hander, and he gets a leading edge into the covers as he looks to play into the on side
length ball outside off, and he opens his face and guides it to backward point
plonks his front foot out outside off and the ball threatens to roll off his front pad onto the stumps, but he goes back and kicks it away
back of a length on off stump, and he defends off the back foot to short midwicket
and here's the Misbah heave. Plays it well, picking it up from outside off, and places this perfectly wide of long-on
down the pitch now, and he flicks this down to deep midwicket
tossed up outside off, and he whips it against the turn to short midwicket
flatter now, and he comes forward to defend to cover
comes forward to this, and waits for it to pitch and turn and dab it down to the right of short third man
tossed up outside off, and he works it with the turn to short midwicket
shortish ball outside off, and he steers it off the back foot to backward point
tossed up outside off and he comes forward and whips it to long-on
back of a length on the stumps, and he goes back and pushes it towards deep midwicket
he's walked across the stumps here, and lap-swept this from middle stump to fine leg
that's full outside off, and Dilshan dives at short midwicket to intercept that whip with the turn
reverse-sweeps from off stump, and Sanga moved once again in anticipation and got a whack on his helmet for his efforts
goes very deep in his crease to this fairly full ball and dabs it down to short third man for the quick single
backs away outside leg, and the bowler follows him, works it away towards midwicket
short ball, and he rocks back and pulls it away to the deep backward square leg boundary
down the pitch now, and drives inside-out from outside leg to short cover
short again, and he rocks back, opens up, and pulls to deep square leg
tossed up, angled towards off, and he comes forward and defends towards point
full, worked away towards square leg
that's flat, on leg stump, and he looks to push it down to mid-on but the bowler anticipates and gets in the way
back of a length and he goes deep in his crease and punches it down to long-off
tossed up on off stump, and he blocks it back to the bowler
tossed up outside off, and he clears his front leg and scythes his bat through the line to launch that over cover
back of a length, angling down the leg side, and he tucks it away to deep square leg
length ball on off stump, and he dabs it away to backward point. Misbah sends him back after he hares out of his crease looking for the quick single
that's swept hard from outside off, his entire body weight swivelling through the shot, and it's struck powerfully wide of short midwicket
tossed up outside off, and he pushes it to point and both batsmen are off the blocks quickly to complete the quick single. Thisara underarmed it to the keeper but Misbah was safely home
back of a length, and he goes deep in his crease to clip it off his pads to deep square leg

full on middle stump, and long-on is right back on the boundary. Fawad works his wrists so it travels towards the fielder, but so slowly that it's Dilshan who hares across to cut it off. Can't prevent the second. Superb placement
back of a length, wide of off, and Misbah misses out as he slaps it straight to point
back of a length again, closer to off this time, and he pushes it wide of cover off the back foot
back of a length, angling across towards off stump, and he stays leg-side of the ball and slaps it to backward point
slower ball angling across, and he looks to dab it down to third man, and gets a thickish outside edge that rolls to the keeper
again it's a length ball angling towards off stump, and he makes a bit of room to slice that, quite deliberately, wide of the keeper for four
short ball down the leg side, Fawad misses the pull, and Sangakkara makes one of his loud appeals to try and distract the umpire from giving the wide. The umpire doesn't fall for it
down the pitch, and Mathews pulls his length back. Fawad pulls it to the right of deep midwicket
short, wide, and he cuts that away powerfully to the point boundary. Terrible ball to start the Powerplay with
swept hard from outside off to square leg

big appeal, and they've gone to the third umpire! Misbah looked to make room there, and Herath bowled it slower, wider, and it dipped and turned past the outside edge. Sanga took the bails off and Misbah did lift his back foot off the ground, but he brought it back down just in time
back of a length, and he pushes this off the back foot to mid-on
sweeps, and sweeps straight into square leg's hands! He was going against the turn, and either didn't pick the gap, or hit it more uppishly than he intended
full outside off, and he drives it hard to the right of the deep cover fielder
short ball, and he fends it away off his face, a little awkwardly but safely enough, behind square leg
back of a length, angling across to off stump, and he gives himself room but steers it straight to point
Crazy single, but they pull it off. Shortish ball, and he pulls from waist-high straight to square leg. Herath fires it at the bowler's end, and misses, or Fawad was short by miles
back of a length on off stump, defended into the off side
short ball outside off, and he pulls it down to deep square leg. That was quite quick but he seemed to have a lot of time to play that shot
slower ball, back of a length, and he gives himself room to dab that from leg stump to point
down the pitch, and he puts the pressure right back on the bowler by launching him over the long-on boundary

big appeal, everyone goes up, but the finger doesn't. They've reviewed it. He plonked his front foot forward to defend, and may have been playing for turn. It went with the angle and hit his front pad. Was it sliding down leg? First of all, it's only pad, and bat hit pad. It hit him in line, and was crashing into a major chunk of leg stump according to Hawkeye, and that means Mr. Maqsood has to walk back to the dressing room. Pakistan are in all sorts of bother now. He took a huge stride down the pitch, and even his back foot was outside the crease, but he's just inside the 3m mark.
that's tossed up outside off, and he whips it down to long-on
full on off stump, and he nurdles that into the leg side, with the turn
onto the pads, and he clips it away backward of square leg

clips this from off stump, but Dilshan runs quickly to his left at midwicket to banish any thoughts of a single from the minds of the batsmen. Sri Lanka's fielding in the circle has been outstanding today
short ball, and he's pulled that powerfully, uppishly down to the deep midwicket boundary. One bounce and over the rope
short again, pulled again, over wide mid-on this time and that's four more
back of a length, cramping him for room, and he works it wristily down to long-on
back of a length on off stump, and he pushes it off the back foot to deep cover
fullish ball on the stumps, and he flicks wristily to deep midwicket, uppish but safe
that's full on off stump, and he's placed that drive clinically to the left of short cover. Four more, and 16 have come off this over
looked to make room again, Herath bowled it wider, he slogged at it and inside-edged to the right of the keeper and overbalanced out of the crease. Sanga throws and misses
backs away from leg stump, works it from outside off to midwicket
full on the stumps, and he pushes that to midwicket again
down the pitch now, and he flat-bats it hard to long-on
what just happened there? Herath bowls a length ball on the off stump, and Afridi plays the most compact, orthodox forward defensive shot you could ever imagine
slants across the left-hander, full and wide of off stump, and he slaps it hard to deep cover
back of a length and very wide outside off. Afridi looks to slash at it but can't connect cleanly, and chops it down into the ground
wide outside off again, fuller now, and this is clearly a plan. They have a man out at a squarish deep cover, and Afridi slices it uppishly, straight into his hands
back of a length, and he pushes it wide of short cover to bring Fawad back on strike
that's full, slanted across, and he drives it down to mid-off
walks across the crease, outside off, and flicks this low full-toss to mid-on
low full-toss on the stumps and he nurdles it down to deep backward square leg
flat and full outside off. Wahab is taking guard outside leg stump, and he pushes it out towards backward point
sweeps, and sweeps to short fine leg. If he missed, that was lbw, crashing into middle stump
down the pitch now, and goes hard at it but hits it straight to wide mid-on
down the leg side now, and he sweeps, but can't get it fine enough to beat short fine leg
length ball om off stump, and he pushes it into the off side with soft hands to steal a single
that's full and wide, and he drills it to deep extra cover

full and wide again, and he goes hard at it and slices it way up. Herath almost drops it on the third man boundary as he tumbles forward, but he manages to hold on despite landing on his elbows. Very good catch in the end
and he's on a hat trick! that's full and wide, slanted across, and he slashes hard at it and slaps the ball straight to cover
no hat-trick for Thisara. That's full outside off, and he opens his face and squeezes it towards slip
back of a length, and Mohammad Irfan moves his feet less than a millimeter as he stands there and defends into the off side
bouncer now, and he manages to sway out of the way, and keep his bat and gloves out of the way even though they shot up reflexively to shield his face
full on off stump, and he pokes it away towards mid-on
that's the yorker, on middle stump, and he calmly brings his bat down to push that to cover
that's very full, outside off, and he scoops it in the air but Dilshan, scrambling backwards and to his right from point can't quite get his hands under it
that's the leg-stumo yorker, and he tickles it onto his pad and it bounces down to the keeper
and finally he gets it right, and the yorker sneaks through to clip the leg stump as Junaid plays all over it
